name: Andrew's Brewing Company
description: Andy Hazen is a workhorse of a brewer. From start to finish, he is a one-man operation. The former cabinetmaker is also a self-reliant Mainer through and through. He was originally an all-grain homebrewer who decided to take it to the next level when his friends expressed interest in his beers. He designed the 12-barrel brewing system himself and enlisted a local welder to help put it together. Hazen notes that when you live in Maine, you have to find some service to provide to others in order to survive. For him, brewing is the service he provides to his local community. Located in the rolling hills of Lincolnville, Maine, Andrew's is housed in a renovated farmhouse next to Hazen's home. Finding the brewery is more than half the battle. Have no fear, however, as everyone knows about Andrew's. Also, be aware that due to some thieving souls, the brewery no longer has any signage to announce its existence to the visiting public. The only indication that a brewery exists in the farmhouse are the occasional keg deliveries in Hazen's front yard. And Hazen hasn't been quick to replace the sign either. While he welcomes visitors, you have to remember to clear a path for the busy brewer. Like many other unsung small brewers, running his 5OO-barrel per year brewery is a seven day a week operation for Hazen. Watching Hazen run the brewery is a little like watching Willy Wonka run the Chocolate Factory. When I visit him during a bottling day, Hazen runs between the bottling line and the packaging supplies in a hurried yet methodical manner. He stands up bottles on the line, starts the machine, slides his way across the brewhouse to the packaging materials, and hand assembles the six-packs that will hold the soon-to-be bottled beer. Andrew's beer is straightforward, unassuming and entirely enjoyable. His product line includes the St. Nick Porter, the Northern Brown Ale, the English Pale Ale, and the summer seasonal Ruby's Golden Ale. A celebration of the Amarillo hop, Hazen's English Pale Ale is a delightfully balanced product that neither over or underwhelms the palate.  from beerscribe.com

name: Barley's Brewing Company
description: The oldest brewpub in the area, opening in 1992. Award-winning craft ales alongside hearty, satisfying pub cuisine. Ale! Ale! The Gang's All Here!

name: Below Grade Brewing
description: In 1992 Dean Wise made his first batch of beer. Things went well--at least nothing blew up. . . and the beer was, um, beer--but he wanted something more. Dean went from using a brew kit to creating his own recipes with shocking amounts of the best malts and hops. Some questioned his sanity, but the result was exceptional beer everyone loved. Having dedicated part of his basement to a brewery, when it came time to name his burgeoning business, Below Grade Brewing was a natural fit.

name: Big Dog's Brewing Company
description: Las Vegas' Original Brewpub... From our days at the Holy Cow in '92 to the present days at Big Dog's Brewing Co., we've been producing and enjoying award winning brews for over 19 years!

name: Black Sheep Brewery
description: Since 1992 Black Sheep Brewery has been brewing fantastic beers in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales.

name: Blackhorse Pub and Brewery
description: When The Blackhorse first opened in 1992, our goal was to provide that neighborhood Pub atmosphere where “everybody knows your name.” Since then we have strived to provide the food, service and atmosphere that would make people want to come back. Today the Blackhorse Pub and Brewery has grown into a mainstay in Historic Downtown Clarksville known for fresh brewed, handcrafted beers, gourmet pizza, steaks and other favorites. Clarksville has many casual dining restaurants today. But, there is only one locally owned brewpub serving the freshest handcrafted ales brewed on site daily right in the heart of downtown Clarksville.

name: Boscos Brewing Company
description:
Boscos is a warm, inviting, first-class restaurant with locations in Memphis, Nashville Little Rock, AR. Boscos believes in using only the freshest products and ingredients in our menu and in our hand-crafted beers.

Each restaurant's menu includes a variety of appetizers, salads, entrees or gourmet pizzas, baked in our brick oven. Signature items include fresh salmon baked on a cedar plank in Boscos brick oven, delicious double-cut pork chop, and a prime cut of steak cooked to perfection.

Boscos has been brewing award-winning handcrafted beers for over 22 years. That experience is evident in both the quality and variety of beers we offer, including the light-bodied, golden Famous Flaming Stone, the amber, crisp Bombay IPA, and our robust, full-bodied stouts and porters. Boscos has a beer to match everyone's tastes and to compliment every delicious dish.

locations.name: Main Brewery - Fenway
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday through Saturday 11 AM until 11 PM

Opens early for Red Sox Opening Day, Marathon Monday and other early Sox/Event Days.

name: Bricktown Brewery
description:
In November 1992, the Bricktown Brewery opened its doors, ushering in a new golden age of urban dining to the OKC scene. Nearly 20 years later, the Brewery has been adrenalized with a new look, new menu and new focus on delivering great food, great beer and a great experience to the citizens of Oklahoma City.

The building which Bricktown Brewery calls home was once a candy factory, and they say that ghosts of the Oompa-Loompas who are buried in the basement haunt guests who don’t leave a good tip. So be aware…and act accordingly.

Sunday 11am-9pm

name: Bricktown Brewery (OKC)
description:
Bricktown Brewery opened in October 1992, making history, quality beers, and great food. This started what has become the most unique setting and entertainment establishment in Oklahoma City!

In keeping with the Brewery’s standard of providing our patrons with an exceptional experience, we have transformed the historical turn-of-the century building into a great place to find award winning beers, great food, and plenty of fun for all ages!

name: Capital City Brewing Company
description: Washington DC's first brewpub since prohibition, Capitol City Brewing Co. opened its doors in 1992. Our first location still stands in Downtown DC, at 11th and H St., NW. Our company policy is to bring the fine craft of brewing to every person who lives and visits our region, as well as treating them to a wonderful meal and a great experience.

name: Dickersbach Brewing Company
description:
A long long time ago, in a far away place called North Carolina it all started. My great friend, and then neighbor, Randy and I decided it was time to start brewing beer since we could not longer get our then favorite brew in the stores. Our first beer was aptly named "Girly Beer" and was light and refreshing.

From there the brews continued until we were out of storage space. Our paths separated, but we each continued brewing. My brother Mike, soon took to brewing also and has been an avid brewer for many years now.

Background experience comes from homebrewing, being head brewer at Hal and Mal's in Jackson, MS, and head brewer at Riverhorse, in Lambertville, NJ.

name: Federal Jack's
description:
Often referred to as the most picturesque pub on the waterfront, Federal Jack's Restaurant and Brew Pub is well-known for its spectacular views, creative pub fare, and award-winning hand-crafted ales. 

Jack's, as it's known by the locals, offers a brew with a view overlooking the Kennebunk River. This award-winning restaurant and brewery was built on the site where, in their heyday, Kennebunk's historic 19th century shipyards built schooners known throughout the world for their grace and speed. Federal Jack's was named for one of the most famous ships built on this site in 1908 - the Federal Jack.

name: Front Street Brewery
description:
Front Street Brewery, nestled beautifully along the bank of the Mighty Mississippi, has served the fine community of Davenport, Iowa for over 17 years. Front Street Brewery prides itself on embracing the local brewing history by providing some of the finest hand-crafted beers and ales in the area. This along with a relaxing dining atmosphere surley makes Front Street Brewery a must stop.


Front Street Brewery, a locally owned and operated business, is committed to continuing this legacy of providing great service and a friendly environment. After all, “We Are the Beer that Makes People Hoppy!”

name: Hogs Back Brewery
description: The Hogs Back Brewery is an independent brewery based in Tongham, Surrey. Our flagship real ale, ‘TEA’ (Traditional English Ale), has proved to be a favourite of cask conditioned ale drinkers throughout the UK and is the proud winner of many awards.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Mon - Tue: 9:00 am - 6:00 pm
Wed - Sat: 9:00 am - 8:30 pm
Sun: 10:00 am - 4:30 pm

name: John Harvard's Brew House
description:
John Harvard’s boasts and extensive list of brews, ranging from the tried and true All Amrican Light Lager to the rich, roasted Dry Irish Stout. In addition, we carry a full-line of seasonal brews, so you’re sure to find the perfect beer any time of year.

When you come to John Harvard’s, please check with your server to find out what specialty beers are available, as well. Our award winning brewers offer a range of beer styles from around the world.

name: McNeill's Brewery
description:
Since 1992, McNeill’s brewery has consistently offered some of the Northeast’s finest beers. Brewmaster Ray McNeill has won accolades far and wide, including thirteen national and international awards.
Critics and food writers alike have praised McNeill’s products, including the Albany Times Union, “McNeill may be the best brewer in America,” or All About Beer Magazine, “The jewel in the crown of Vermont’s many fine beers.”
In 2008 McNeill opened the long rumored packaging facility just north of the venerable brewpub.
Today, McNeill’s packages ten different beers plus seasonals.

name: Moonlight Brewing Company
description: Moonlight Brewery was started in rural Santa Rosa in 1992 by Brian Hunt. Small by most all comparisons, the brewery has capacity for about 1000 barrels per year. Whereas the original brewery was in a converted tractor barn, today it is in a building built in 2003 for this brewery. Currently all the beers are only sold in kegs and can be found in San Francisco, the East Bay and North Bay counties. Mendocino and Lake Counties have a few spots, and there are rare sightings in Santa Cruz, Seal Beach, and San Diego.

name: Morgantown Brewing Company
description: Morgantown's oldest and newest brewpub, located in the heart of downtown Morgantown West Virginia. This casual local pub offers a wide range of craft beers brewed on the premises, great food, a live music venue and full calendar of events.   Meet friends for lunch or dinner, or have a beer and watch the big game on TV.  A must visit for craft beer lovers.

name: Ouray Brewery
description:
he Ouray Brewery is  open daily. Our brewery has three levels — with fine food and outstanding craft brews offered on each floor. Level one houses our kitchen and intimate pub. Level two offers our main dining area and brewery. And level three boasts the only rooftop patio in the “Switzerland of America” — Ouray, Colorado.

Ouray has all the right ingredients — unspoiled scenery and water, a great local community and culture and close proximity to other great breweries. Come join us for a brew and a taste of all Ouray and Ouray Brewery have to offer.

name: Rohrbach Brewing Company
description:
The Rohrbach Brewing Company has been brewing handcrafted ales and lagers in Rochester for over a decade! Loyal Rohrbach customers from near and far continue to prove that there is a market for premium high quality lagers and ales.

All of our ales and lagers are made with only the finest ingredients available worldwide; two-row malted barley from Belgium and the freshest hops from Europe and the Pacific Northwest . Our lagers and ales are delivered cold and fresh, with no artificial preservatives or flavor deteriorating pasteurization, which insures that your customers enjoy them at their peak freshness.

name: Tring Brewery
description: Founded in 1992 Tring Brewery has established itself as one of the leading breweries in Hertfordshire. In addition to their core products that include the multi award winning Jack O'Legs, Side Pocket for a Toad, Colley's Dog and Death or Glory the brewery also produces seasonal ales and monthly specials. From it's 30BB plant these are distributed across the UK and sold from their on site brewery shop.
